medical_history.chief_complaint: Permanent neonatal diabetes mellitus diagnosed at 3 months of age.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed during an episode of acute gastroenteritis at age 3 months, presenting with a blood glucose level of 440 mg/dl and glycosylated hemoglobin of 13.3%. No episodes of diabetic ketoacidosis were reported despite several infections and a temporary interruption of insulin therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a KCNJ11 mutation identified, but no other significant medical history was mentioned. He was treated with insulin therapy initially and then switched to oral sulfonylureas with stable metabolic control.
medical_history.family_history: The mutation was confirmed to have arisen de novo in the patient. A younger sibling is healthy.
